1:
Pay attention, Shepherd of Israel,
\q you who lead Joseph like a flock;
\q you who sit above the cherubim, shine on us!
\q
3:
God, restore us;
\q make your face shine on us, and we will be saved.
4:
Yahweh God of hosts,
\q how long will you be angry at your people when they pray?
\q
5:
You have fed them with the bread of tears
\q and given them tears to drink in great quantities.
\q
6:
You make us something for our neighbors to argue over,
\q and our enemies laugh about us among themselves.
8:
You brought a vine out of Egypt;
\q you drove out nations and transplanted it.
10:
The mountains were covered with its shade,
\q the cedars of God by its branches.
\q
11:
It sent out its branches as far as the sea
\q and its shoots to the Euphrates River.
12:
Why have you broken down its walls
\q so that all they who pass by pluck its fruit.
\q
13:
The boars out of the forest ruin it,
\q and the beasts of the field feed on it.
15:
This is the root that your right hand planted,
\q the shoot that you made to grow.
\q
16:
It has been burned and cut down;
\q they perish because of your rebuke.
17:
May your hand be on the man of your right hand,
\q on the son of man whom you made strong for yourself.
\q
18:
Then we will not turn away from you;
\q revive us, and we will call on your name.
19:
Yahweh, God of hosts, restore us;
\q make your face shine on us, and we will be saved.
80:
\m
\d For the chief musician, set to the Shoshannim Eduth style. A psalm of Asaph.
\q
